**Edited <time datetime="2017-02-01T00:10:31Z" title="02/01/2017 12:10  AM" data-short="7 yr">February 1, 2017</time> by BlackHoleSun**

Are you asking on the "Sequencer" thread for an update to IR for legacy IR parts?

BTW all of this does indeed work

**For those having install / KJR issues**

List of IR download files to work with KSP 1.2.2 courtesy of: [<u><font color="#0066cc">@Agustin</font></u>](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/172127-agustin/) [<u><font color="#0066cc">@V8jester</font></u>](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/136093-v8jester/)

Steps to install Infernal Robotics

1) install Core Download which is the plugin and "core Files" of IR  (No parts are in this download)

2) Install Parts Pack (Legacy is the original parts, and Rework are the new white parts. You can have both installed if you wish)

3) **Optional** -  If you wish to use the Surface sampler (Install the Surfacesampler.dll into GameData/MagicSmokeIndustries/Parts/Rework\_Utility/Plugins)

4) **Optional**  - If you are using KJR you will need to use the supplied DEV Version Linked below.

**Core Download**

Infernal Robotics (Ziw) 2.0.10 [<u><font color="#0066cc">https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/InfernalRobotics/releases/download/2.0.10/IR-2.0.10-Final-Core.zip</font></u>](https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/InfernalRobotics/releases/download/2.0.10/IR-2.0.10-Final-Core.zip)

**Parts**

Legacy Parts (Ziw) [<u><font color="#0066cc">https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/InfernalRobotics/releases/download/2.0.0/IR-LegacyParts.zip</font></u>](https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/InfernalRobotics/releases/download/2.0.0/IR-LegacyParts.zip)

IR Rework Parts (Zodiusinfuser) [<u><font color="#0066cc">https://mega.nz/#!rdlHkLAJ!ZizDvd8s7zCIG529FtO8b7wM0avJ8yC3pldIaf6BGFw</font></u>](https://mega.nz/#!rdlHkLAJ!ZizDvd8s7zCIG529FtO8b7wM0avJ8yC3pldIaf6BGFw)

IR Surface Sampler dll (Ziw) [<u><font color="#0066cc">https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/IR-Surface-Sampler/tree/master/GameData/MagicSmokeIndustries/Parts/Rework_Utility/Plugins</font></u>](https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/IR-Surface-Sampler/tree/master/GameData/MagicSmokeIndustries/Parts/Rework_Utility/Plugins)

**Utility**

Thread link for IR Sequencer (Ziw) [<u><font color="#0066cc">http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/104547-12-ir-sequencer-v101-add-on-to-infernal-robotics-updated-30102016/</font></u>](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/104547-12-ir-sequencer-v101-add-on-to-infernal-robotics-updated-30102016/)

**Kerbal Joint Reinforcement - Fixed for IR**

"Dev version - use at your own risk"

Dev version of KJR (Ferram4) [<u><font color="#0066cc">https://github.com/ferram4/Kerbal-Joint-Reinforcement</font></u>](https://github.com/ferram4/Kerbal-Joint-Reinforcement)

Please feel free to repost / update this list every so often to help a lot of the new comers

i would not recommend using joint reinforcement, makes things too stiff for natural movement when building a mech and will compromise stability [@V8jester](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/136093-v8jester/)

aaa, btw i found a new way to stabilize mechs in running speeds of 15m/s and i will show it in my next design ^^

[@Ziw](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/135292-ziw/)

Would it be possible to add the ability to have servos move to next or previous preset as an option along side exact angle movement? I want to make a universal sequence for a rotatron with 6x radial symmetry on the child part, so I don't want to make 6 separate sequences for the servo. I can give more specifics if needed, but this is the simplest solution for me. Thanks! 

**Edited <time datetime="2017-02-22T20:57:19Z" title="02/22/2017 08:57  PM" data-short="7 yr">February 22, 2017</time> by Svm420**
Does IR Sequencer ignores Speed and Acceleration that's set on each of the parts?

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, SHiRKiT said:
> 
> 
> Does IR Sequencer ignores Speed and Acceleration that's set on each of the parts?
> 

I am pretty sure it ignores speed as you can set it when creating a sequence. I think it obeys accel though.

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, SHiRKiT said:
> 
> 
> Does IR Sequencer ignores Speed and Acceleration that's set on each of the parts?
> 

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, Svm420 said:
> 
> 
> I am pretty sure it ignores speed as you can set it when creating a sequence. I think it obeys accel though.
> 

Actually both speed and accel are relevant when creating something. For instance my and [@Tirehtoori R.I.P](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/149732-tirehtoori-rip/)'s walkers use speed and accel numbers in excess of 200+ during assembly, to get things moving fast enough.
